t: Isaiah 19
An Oracle Concerning Egypt

An*p oracle concerning Egypt. Behold,*pn the Lord*s is riding on a swift cloud and*ld comes to Egypt; and*ln the idols of Egypt will tremble at his presence, and*ld the heart of the Egyptians will melt within them.
And*ln I will stir up Egyptians against Egyptians, and*ld they will fight, each against another and*ld each against his neighbor, city*ld against city, kingdom against kingdom;

and*ln the spirit of the Egyptians within them will be emptied out, and*ld I will confound their counsel; and*ln they will inquire of the idols and the sorcerers, and*ld the mediums and the necromancers;
and*ln I will give over the Egyptians into*ld the hand of a hard master, and*ln a fierce king will rule over them, declares*ld the Lord God*s of hosts.
And*pn the waters of the sea will be dried up, and*ld the river will be dry and parched,
and*ln its canals will become foul, and*ld the branches of Egypt’s Nile will diminish and dry up, reeds*ld and rushes will rot away.
There*ln will be bare places by the Nile, on*ld the brink of the Nile, and*ln all that is sown by the Nile will be parched, will*ld be driven away, and will be no more.
The*ln fishermen will mourn and lament, all*ld who cast a hook in the Nile; and*ln they will languish who*ld spread nets on the water.
The*ln workers in combed flax will be in despair, and*ld the weavers of white cotton.
Those*ln who are the pillars of the land will be crushed, and*ld all who work for pay will be grieved.
The*pn princes of Zoan are utterly foolish; the*ld wisest counselors of Pharaoh give stupid counsel. How*ln can you say to Pharaoh, “I*ld am a son of the wise, a*ld son of ancient kings”?
Where*ln then are your wise men? Let*ld them tell you that*ld they might know what the Lord*s of hosts has purposed against Egypt.
The*ln princes of Zoan have become fools, and*ld the princes of Memphis are deluded; those*ln who are the cornerstones of her tribes have*ld made Egypt stagger.
The*ln Lord*s has mingled within her a spirit of confusion, and*ln they will make Egypt stagger in all its deeds, as*ld a drunken man staggers in his vomit.
And*ln there will be nothing for Egypt that*ld head or tail, palm branch or reed, may do.
Egypt, Assyria, Israel Blessed
In*p that day the Egyptians will be like women, and tremble with fear before the hand that the Lord*s of hosts shakes over them.
And the land of Judah will become a terror to the Egyptians. Everyone to whom it is mentioned will fear because of the purpose that the Lord*s of hosts has purposed against them.
In*p that day there will be five cities in the land of Egypt that speak the language of Canaan and swear allegiance to the Lord*s of hosts. One of these will be called the City of Destruction.
In*p that day there will be an altar to the Lord*s in the midst of the land of Egypt, and a pillar to the Lord*s at its border.
It will be a sign and a witness to the Lord*s of hosts in the land of Egypt. When they cry to the Lord*s because of oppressors, he will send them a savior and defender, and deliver them.

And the Lord*s will make himself known to the Egyptians, and the Egyptians will know the Lord*s in that day and worship with sacrifice and offering, and they will make vows to the Lord*s and perform them.
And the Lord*s will strike Egypt, striking and healing, and they will return to the Lord,*s and he will listen to their pleas for mercy and heal them.
In*p that day there will be a highway from Egypt to Assyria, and Assyria will come into Egypt, and Egypt into Assyria, and the Egyptians will worship with the Assyrians.
In*p that day Israel will be the third with Egypt and Assyria, a blessing in the midst of the earth,
whom the Lord*s of hosts has blessed, saying, “Blessed be Egypt my people, and Assyria the work of my hands, and Israel my inheritance.”
